org.apache.river.qa.harness

Class SharedGroupAdmin

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.river.qa.harness.AbstractServiceAdmin
      • org.apache.river.qa.harness.SharedGroupAdmin
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Admin

    public class SharedGroupAdmin
extends AbstractServiceAdmin
implements Admin
    An admin for a shared activation group.

    This admin supports the special service property "implPrefix" which is interpreted as the serviceName associated with the groups administrative service. After the shared group is created, the activatable service identified by this serviceName is started; it is this proxy which is returned by calls to this admins getProxy method.

    The logger named org.apache.river.qa.harness.service is used to log debug information

    Level Description
    FINE parameter values used to start the service, and a message indicating whether shared VM mode is being used

        public SharedGroupAdmin(QAConfig config,
                        String serviceName,
                        int index,
                        String[] options,
                        String[] properties,
                        AdminManager manager)
        Construct an SharedGroupAdmin. This constructor allows options and properties to be provided. It is intended for use when a service creates a private shared group and applies its own vm arguments to the group VM.
        Parameters:
        config - the configuration object for the test run
        serviceName - the service name
        index - the instance number for this service
        options - VM options to be added to the set provided by the superclass
        properties - VM properties to be added to the set provided by the superclass

      • start

        public void start()
           throws RemoteException,
                  TestException
        Configures and starts an instance of the shared group named serviceName provided in the constructor.

        A check is made that the activation system is running. If the check fails, a TestException is thrown.

        If the shared group log file passed in the constructor is null, a unique temporary name is generated and registered for automatic deletion.

        A SharedActivationGroupDescriptor is contructed and it's create method is called, passing the starter configuration object. The serviceName for the group's administrative service is identified by the service parameter "implPrefix". An ActivatableServiceStarterAdmin is constructed using the prefix, and the start method called. The proxy for the groups administrative service is retrieved from this admin and is saved as the serviceRef.

        Specified by:
        start in interface Admin
        Throws:
        TestException - if any of the mandatory service starter parameters cannot be found. The mandatory well-known tokens are: impl, codebase, classpath, policyfile, implPrefix. It is also thrown if the activation system is not up, if a shared group log directory was specified which already exists, or if any exception is thrown while attempting to start the service.
        RemoteException - never. Any RemoteExceptions which occur while attempting to start the service will be wrapped in a TestException.

      • killVM

        public void killVM()
            throws RemoteException
        Kill the group VM. The killer service is started on demand the first time this method is called. The proxy is cached and reused on subsequent calls.
        Throws:
        RemoteException - if an error occurs while attempting to start or call the back end service

      • stop

        public void stop()
          throws RemoteException
        Destroys the shared group managed by this admin by calling the destroyVM method on the groups administrative service.
        Specified by:
        stop in interface Admin
        Throws:
        RemoteException - if destroying the shared group failed

      • getSharedGroupLog

        public File getSharedGroupLog()
        Return the shared VM log directory name associated with this shared group. The start method must be called before calling this accessor.
        Returns:
        the shared vm log dir (which may be null)
